result.execSummary:
The defendant Chad M Brunner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. The defendant is to have NO CONFRONTATIONAL contact with J. Brunner.

Defendant to complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program together with any follow through counseling and/or treatment as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Chad M Brunner

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: 3:39 pm case called. Defendant Chad M Brunner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. ADA Anderson states agreement on the record. Attorney Szilagyi concurs.   Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea: No Contest to Counts 1 & 2.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places on probation for a period of 2 years. Concurrent to any existing sentence. CONDITIONS: DAAP and follow through, Absolute sobriety, Not to be on the premises of any bars, not to be in possession of any impairing substances without a valid prescription from a treating physician, No Confrontational contact with J. Brunner. Costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. DNA sample & surcharge. Appeal Rights Given.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Ben Szilagyi in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Resolution has been reached-request plea sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Chad M Brunner
Current: 546 Pleasant St, Oshkosh, WI 54901-4920 United States  (Effective: 07-07-2015)
Prior: N951 32nd Ave, Berlin, WI 54923

The defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons, including but not limited to firearms. The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

1:03 pm case called. Defendant Chad M Brunner in court with attorney Ben Szilagyi.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  NGP entered.   STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2015 at 09:15 am.
